conclusion: Let v₀ be the speed just before the ball strikes the floor, v₁ be the speed just after it rebounds, g the magnitude of the gravitational acceleration, λ mg (0 < λ < (H – h)/(H + h)) the magnitude of the opposing air-resistance force.

premise: Net downward acceleration = g – λg = (1 – λ)g. From rest: v₀² = 2(1 – λ)gH.
Net downward acceleration = g + λg = (1 + λ)g. At the top of the rise the speed is zero, so v₁² = 2(1 + λ)gh.

conclusion: v_after / v_before = √[ (1 + λ) h / (1 – λ) H ].
